results.name: Triangle T, read by rows, such that the matrix square, T^2, forms a simple 2-diagonal triangle where [T^2](n,n) = 1 and [T^2](n+1,n) = 2*(n+1) for n>=0.
formula: Exponential Riordan array [sqrt(1 + 2*x),x] with e.g.f. sqrt(1+2*x)*exp(t*x) = 1 + (1+t)*x + (-1+2*t+t^2)*x^2/2! + ... . The n-th row polynomial R(n,x) is given by the type B Dobinski formula R(n,x) = exp(-x/2)*sum {k = 0..inf} (2*k+1)*(2*k-1)*...*(2*k+1-2*(n-1))*(x/2)^k/k!. Cf. A122848. - _Peter Bala_, Jun 23 2014
example: and A001147 forms the odd double factorials.
and A000165 forms the even double factorials.
